title: Snooker news: European Masters heads to Austria for first ranking event in the country
text:
Joe Perry and Jimmy Robertson contested the European Masters final last year in Lommel, Belgium. (Picture: Getty Images)

The venue for this season’s European Masters has been confirmed as Dornbirn in Austria, as the country prepares to host its first ever ranking event.

The Messe Dornbirn will be the venue for the event, which holds the very appealing top prize of £80,000 and will be played from 22-26 January.

The European Masters has been running in its current guise since 2016, being held for the last two years in Lommel, Belgium, and previously in Bucharest, Romania.

Jimmy Robertson was the surprise winner of the tournament last season and will go to Austria as the defending champion, having won his first and only ranking event last year in Lommel.

The event will be the first of four making up the brand new BetVictor European Series, which also includes the German Masters, Shootout and Gibraltar Open.

The four-tournament series will carry its own ranking list, and the player winning the most money over the events will gain a £150,000 bonus.

The 2020 BetVictor European Series • BetVictor European Masters, 20-26 Jan, Dornbirn, Austria

• BetVictor German Masters, 29 January – 2 Feb, Berlin, Germany

• BetVictor Shoot Out – 20-23 Feb, Watford, England

• BetVictor Gibraltar Open – 13-15 Mar, Gibraltar

‘We are delighted to be staging a world ranking event in Austria for the first time in our history,’ said World Snooker chairman Barry Hearn. ‘It’s another major step forward in our quest to make snooker a global sport.

‘We have seen fantastic figures for television and digital audiences in Austria in recent years and now the fans there have the chance to see the world’s best players competing live for a prestigious trophy.

‘The venue in Dornbirn is superb and it is a beautiful part of Austria so we will to see fans coming from far afield to experience the event.

‘It’s the first tournament in the BetVictor European Series so the top players will aim to get off to a strong start, with their eyes on the £150,000 bonus. We look forward to a great event.’

Dornbirn is a small city right in the western corner of Austria, bordering Switzerland, with a population of only around 50,000.

Qualifiers for the European Masters will be played at the same time as for the German Masters, from 17-22 December in Barnsley, with only 32 players heading to Austria, so two wins needed.
